Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of the BEACON Caresystem in Mechanical Ventilation Weaning

Trial_Design.evidence: Conducted as a multicentre, randomised controlled trial

Participants.evidence: adult ICU patients ventilated for over 24 hours

Intervention.evidence: Participants were randomised to either the BEACON Caresystem (intervention) or usual care (control)

Objective.evidence: This study assesses the BEACON Caresystem, a decision support tool, for its impact on ventilation duration.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the duration of mechanical ventilation from intubation to successful extubation.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was computer-generated, with allocation concealment via sealed envelopes.

Blinding.evidence: Blinding was not feasible due to the nature of the intervention.

Number_Randomised.evidence: From September 2017 to March 2020, 252 patients were randomised (58 intervention, 54 control).

Result_Outcome.evidence: No significant difference in ventilation duration was found between groups.

Harms.evidence: Adverse events were reported in 9% of the intervention group compared to 15% in the control group.
